episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the official mud used in Major League Baseball, the unique C-section parties in Brazil, Samuel Johnson's use of Latin in France, and the origin of YouTube linked to the search for a specific Super Bowl video.

facts.fact: Major League Baseball has an official mud.
In Brazil, women throw C-section parties where guests are served champagne and canap√©s while watching the host have a Caesarean section through a viewing window.
When Samuel Johnson visited Paris, he worried that his French wasn't good enough, so he spent the whole time speaking in Latin.
YouTube was created because one of its founders couldn't find an online video of Janet Jackson's breast being exposed at the Super Bowl halftime show.
